title.narrative: PPG: Reducing Vulnerability of Banana Producing Communities to Climate Change Through Banana Value Added Activities

description.narrative: Banana is by far the most important crop in Uganda grown by over 70% of the farming population and supplying about 30% of the food consumed. Bananas are marketed and consumed mostly in fresh form, with a short shelf life and with little value addition activities involved. However, there is a huge potential for further value addition and by-product utilization. Different parts of the plant can be processed into foods, textiles, accessories and craft, and biogas. The lack of industrial activities is due to a number of issues including inadequate production capacities resulting in decline in the supply of fresh banana, inadequate infrastructure for value addition and inadequate opportunities for marketing. This project will take a value chain approach to improve the overall performance of the banana sector, incorporating appropriate low carbon production technologies ensuring sustainable natural resource management, as well as identifying and promoting investment opportunities. It will be implemented in two phases with Phase I aiming to identify the value chain(s) to address and to assist the government to set a policy in place to ensure the sustainability of the banana sector, then Phase II will focus on the actual interventions to develop the sector based on the value chain(s) identified in the Phase I.
